page.title: 01HONLEY GAZETTEER
page.content: Honley is a large village, seven kilometres south of the West Yorkshire town of Huddersfield. It is situated, along with the neighbouring villages of Berry Brow,Brockholes and Netherton in the valley of the River Holme. This is an extremely pleasant area with a good deal of woodland and grassland ideal for the rambler. Job opportunities are confined to a number of small factories. Much of the housing is privately owned, although a small number of council estates exist. The usual amenities are found:shops, schools,a sprinkling of non_conformist churches, and leisure pursuits, with facilities for Cricket, Soccer, Hockey and Squash. Public Houses and clubs provide social activities,whilst entertainment can be found at a few venues, most notably at Honley's Southgate Theatre.
